intro: Vignantha touranginiana, commonly known as the Indian wild bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to parts of South and Southeast Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its pods contain seeds that are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Vignantha touranginiana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and along forest edges.
